title: O.J. Simpson: Michigan football's Jim Harbaugh can fix the Cleveland Browns
text:
CLOSE Michigan football head coach Jim Harbaugh speaks to the media on Monday, Oct. 28, 2019, in Ann Arbor. Orion Sang, Detroit Free Press

OK, before you roll your eyes, hear us out.

Once upon a time, O.J. Simpson was one of the premier football commentators on television. The Hall of Fame running back with a — ahem — checkered criminal past has taken to Twitter in the past year and seems to be a natural for the medium.

In his most recent post, Simpson tried to provide some hope for the Cleveland Browns, who entered this season with high expectations but have sputtered to a 2-5 start with first-year coach Freddie Kitchens.

"A lot of great college coaches don't do well in the pros, Jimmy Johnson and Pete Carroll exception," Simpson said. "But there's a guy that was a good college coach that I think was better as a pro coach, and he's right next door to you, Cleveland.

"His name is Jim Harbaugh, and I think he's the elixir to all of your problems.

"I'm just saying," Simpson said to conclude the video.

BOWL PROJECTIONS: LSU moves in after Oklahoma falls out of College Football Playoff

HEISMAN WATCH: LSU QB Joe Burrow takes over as front-runner from Jalen Hurts

Kudos to @JoeFlacco, Congratulations to Coach Belichick & @Browns the answer is right next door. pic.twitter.com/2qfCp6G2mV — O.J. Simpson (@TheRealOJ32) October 28, 2019

If — and we stress if — Harbaugh took the Cleveland gig, it would mark the second U-M coach to leave Ann Arbor for that city. John Beilein is in his first NBA season right now with the Cavaliers after a successful run with the Wolverines.

And could you imagine the Harbaugh Bowl twice a year between Jim in Cleveland and brother John in Baltimore?

The Harbaugh-to-NFL rumors seem to be an annual tradition. The coach tried to address rumblings that emerged via Football Scoop last week, calling it "total crap" in a letter addressed to his players' parents.

description: O.J. Simpson has some advice for the Cleveland Browns, and it involves hiring Michigan football coach Jim Harbaugh. He made his case on Twitter.
